subject: Digital Project Management
description: Digital project management instruction will help your students understand the planning, documentation, and design tasks that inform the production and preservation of digital projects at the Unviersity of Idaho and across the country.

subject: Research Data Management
description: Research data management (RDM) includes the planning, organization, curation, storage, archiving, and sharing of data produced during a research project. Instruction requests might include any one or more of these tasks, and/or discussions about tools and systems used to achieve RDM.

subject: GIS & Web Mapping
description: GIS is a powerful tool for integrating, managing, and analyzing geographic information in order to solve spatial problems. GIS questions might include locating, collecting, managing, documenting, visualizing, or analyzing spatial data. Instruction can be provided for ArcGIS Online, a web-based collaborative mapping platform that is available to faculty and students for teaching and scholarly research, or open-source tools.

subject: Research Information Management
fullsubject: Managing Research Information (e.g. Citation Data, Bibliometrics, Data About Research Activities)
description: Research information management (RIM) involves data about research activities and their outputs, such as publications, presentations, and other products. RIM questions might involve identifying, extracting, re-using, organizing, or sharing data about research activities or the common systems and tools used in managing this information.

subject: Digital Collections
description: Digital Collections instruction will provide an overview of the digital collections at the Universtiy of Idaho and the primary sources from which they are made. A variety of topics can be covered: digital curation, digitization, visualizations, metadata, and many more.

subject: Digital Humanities
description: Digital Humanities instruction will cover a variety of tools and techniques associated with the DH field. Instructors can address a variety of topics and data formats, as well as present the history of the field.

subject: Excel
description: Instruction on this topic will provide an overview of Excel basics as well as time-saving tricks. Sessions can also focus on advanced features such as functions, charts and graphs, and Pivot tables.

subject: Git and Github
fullsubject: Version Control with Git and Github
description: Collaborate with colleagues using Git version control.

subject: WordPress
description: Build a professional website using WordPress.

subject: Creating Scholarly Websites
description: Want to showcase your scholarship? Build a scholarly website and share your ideas with the world.

subject: Content Management Systems
description: Learn which systems can help you to best manage your digital content and webspaces.

subject: Government Information
description: Government documents, including maps, census data, and reports, can be useful resources for your research project.

subject: Print Maps & Aerial Photos
description: Our library collection features hundreds of maps and aerial photos. Learn how to find and access them today!

subject: Finding OA and OERs
description: Open Access and Open Educational Resources make information more accessible. Learn how to easily locate and utilize them in classes and research.

subject: Social Science Research
description: Disciplinary instruction for CLASS (Social Sciences). Instruction in this area will provide an overview of the strategies and resources for conducting library research in the social sciences. Sessions can also focus on finding data and statistics; conducting newspaper research; and identifying sources created by government agencies, NGOs, IGOs, and think tanks.

subject: Art & Architecture Research
description: Disciplinary instruction for Art, Architecture, Interior Design, and Landscape Architecture students and researchers is available. Learn what resources the library offers and how to easily access them.

subject: Business & Economics
description: Disciplinary instruction for business students and researchers is available. Learn what resources the library offers and how to easily access them.

subject: Science Research
description: Disciplinary instruction for College of Science students and researchers is available. Learn what resources the library offers and how to easily access them.

subject: Science Info Literacy
description: Learn how to find, access, and evaluate scientific information.

subject: Agriculture Research
description: Disciplinary instruction for College of Agriculture and Life Sciences students and researchers is available. Learn what resources the library offers and how to easily access them.

subject: History Research
description: Disciplinary instruction for history students and researchers is available. Learn what resources the library offers and how to easily access them.

subject: Natural Resources Research
description: Disciplinary instruction for College of Natural Resources students and researchers is available. Learn what resources the library offers and how to easily access them.

subject: Environmental Science Research
description: Disciplinary instruction for College of Natural Resources students and researchers is available. Learn what resources the library offers and how to easily access them.

subject: Creative Writing & Poetry Research
description: Disciplinary instruction for creative writing and poetry students and researchers is available. Learn what resources the library offers and how to easily access them.

subject: Readers' Advisory: Current Literature
fullsubject: Readers' Advisory: Fiction, Popular Nonfic, Biography, Memoir
description: Need a good book? We can help! Get in touch with a librarian today to discover your next great read.

subject: Interpreting Primary Sources
description: Special Collections hosts fascinating and unique primary sources. Learn how to interpret them by getting in touch with a librarian today!

subject: Finding Primary Sources
description: Special Collections hosts fascinating and unique primary sources. Learn how to find and access them by getting in touch with a librarian today!

subject: Online Newspaper Research
description: Instruction on this topic will provide an overview of the online newspaper resources available at the University of Idaho and useful research strategies. Sessions can include various topics, such as searching for regional and national coverage of a topic or comparing historic and current media reporting.

subject: How To Publish OA
description: Want to publish in an Open Access journal but don't know where to start? We can help!

subject: Agile Project Management
description: Learn how to use Agile Project Management techniques to efficiently complete projects with your team.

subject: Publication Life Cycle
description: Instruction on this topic will offer an in-depth look at specific aspects of the publishing life cycle, including peer-review, publishing models, author's rights following publication, and measures of impact.

subject: Information Evaluation
description: With more information available than ever before, it is important to learn how to evaluate information sources. Undergraduate student instruction on information literacy includes learning about the information timeline, how to differentiate between popular and scholarly sources, and how to evaluate information sources, including websites.

subject: Library Core Search Skills
description: Every library is different -- learn how to efficiently and easily use the University of Idaho's by getting in touch with a librarian today!

subject: Library Tour
description: What does the University of Idaho Library have to offer! Learn about the library and see all our spaces on a personal guided tour.

subject: Developing a Research Topic
fullsubject: Developing a Research Topic / Thinking Like a Researcher
description: Struggling to come up with a topic for your research paper? Discuss your ideas with a librarian to learn strategies for developing a great research question.

subject: Citations & Style Guides
description: Learn how to easily and correctly cite sources and write papers using style guides.

subject: Avoiding Plagiarism
description: Avoid plagiarism by learning how to correctly utilize and cite your sources.

subject: Zotero
description: Learn how to keep your citations and notes organized with this free and easy to use platform.

subject: Web Archiving Citations
description: Learn how to archive website citations using perma.cc.

subject: Instructional Design
description: Are you looking for teaching solutions to help your students learn new ideas and skills more efficiently and effectively? The instructional design approach is a systematic process that determines the needs of learners, defines the goal of instruction, and develops instructional solutions to achieve the desired outcome.

subject: Multimedia Production
description: Do you want to create and edit audiovisual projects like videos, podcasts, etc.? The Studio has the software and equipment to meet all your creative needs.
